BLS Provider (For Healthcare Providers)

$62.10

BLS Provider (For Healthcare Providers)

The registration fee is NON-REFUNDABLE to reserve your seat for this class.

American Heart Association Basic Life Support course is designed for healthcare providers who must have a card documenting successful completion of a CPR course.

After successfully completing this course, students should be able to:

Describe the importance of high-quality CPR and its impact on survival

Describe all of the steps of the Chain of Survival and apple the BLS concepts Recognize the signs of someone needing CPR Perform high-quality CPR for adults, children and infants Describe the importance of early use of an AED and demonstrate its use Provide effective ventilations by using a barrier device Describe the importance of teams in multi-rescuer resuscitation and perform as an effective team member during multi-rescuer CPR Describe the technique for relief of foreign-body airway obstruction (choking) for adults and infants

Upon successful completion of the course, including a first aid skills demonstration and a CPR and AED skills and written test, students receive a BLS for Healthcare Providers Course Completion Card, valid for two years.

Price includes 2.9% Credit Transaction fee

CPR and AED (Non-Healthcare Providers)

$62.10

CPR and AED (Non-Healthcare Providers)

The registration fee is NON-REFUNDABLE to reserve your seat for this class.

ASHI (American Safety & Health Institute) CPR & AED is a classroom and skills course regulated under the American Heart Association Guidelines.

After successfully completing this course, students should be able to:

Recognize elements of common injuries and illnesses

Describe how to find information on preventing illness and injury

Describe how high-quality CPR improves survival

Explain the concepts of the Chain of Survival

Recognize when someone needs CPR

Perform high-quality CPR on an adult, child, and infant

Perform as a team member during multi-rescuer CPR

Give effective breaths using mouth-to-mouth or a mask for all age groups

Demonstrate how to use an AED on an adult, child, and infant

Price includes 2.9% Credit Transaction fee

CPR, AED & First Aid (Non-Healthcare)

$67.99


CPR, AED, & First Aid (Non-Healthcare)

The registration fee is NON-REFUNDABLE to reserve your seat for this class.

ASHI (American Safety & Health Institute) CPR & AED is a classroom and skills course regulated under the American Heart Association Guidelines.

After successfully completing this course, students should be able to:

Recognize elements of common injuries and illnesses

Describe how to find information on preventing illness and injury

Describe how high-quality CPR improves survival

Explain the concepts of the Chain of Survival

Recognize when someone needs CPR

Perform high-quality CPR on an adult, child, and infant

Perform as a team member during multi-rescuer CPR

Give effective breaths using mouth-to-mouth or a mask for all age groups

Demonstrate how to use an AED on an adult, child, and infant

HeartCode - BLS Skills Session

$36.50


HeartCode - BLS Skills Session

The registration fee is NON-REFUNDABLE to reserve your seat for this class.

Before you attend your skills session, you must complete Part 1 Online Heartcode BLS course. https://elearning.heart.org/course/21

After successful completion of the cognitive portion of the course, students receive a Part 1 completion certificate to be presented to the instructor before proceeding with the skills session.

The Skills Session takes 15 minutes. Please arrive during the hours you have selected for your skills session. Be sure to bring your online certification of completion with you to the skills session.

Price includes 2.9% Credit Transaction fee

ACLS Hands-On Skills Session

$149.21


ACLS Hands-On SKills Session

The registration fee is NON-REFUNDABLE to reserve your seat for this class.

Before you attend your Skills Session, you must complete Part 1 Online Heartcode ACLS course. https://shopcpr.heart.org/heartcode-acls

After successful completion of the cognitive portion of the course, students receive a Part 1 completion certificate to be presented to the instructor before proceeding with the skills session.

The Skills Session takes 60 minutes. Please arrive at the hour you have selected for your skills session. Be sure to bring your American Heart Association Online Certification of Completion with you to the skills session.

Price includes 2.9% Credit Transaction fee
